timeline.message: Add explanatory comments for permissions workarounds

Move full backend test to separate module

- Created new module full-backend-tests
- Run all tests in module with failsafe, not surefire,
  to ensure that they only run on `mvn verify`.
  This allows running `mvn package` without running
  these slow tests.

Disable failsafe integration tests on travis explicitly

`-Dmaven.test.skip=true` was not enough in the second `after_success` step.

Avoid recreating containers for GraylogBackend per test class

Converted GraylogBackend to singleton. This ensures that images
and containers can reused globally.

Allow remote debugging of graylog server

This allows to attach a remote debugger to the server container.
The biggest caveat is that the dynamic port to which the debugger can be
attached is only known after starting the container. Hence one would
have to set a breakpoint after the container start to pause execution,
identify the debug port and start the remote debugger with it.

- Added debug toggle via env var GRAYLOG_IT_DEBUG_SERVER
- Added optional debug build arg to container
- Added logging of debug port, if debugging is enabled
- Extracted building the container to NodeContainerFactory
Added param object NodeContainerConfig

timeline.message:
Adding first spike with ngnix dummy

`GraylogBackendExtension` should later control all involved containers,
including graylog node(s), mongodb, and elasticsearch.
For now it controls only a dummy container as a placeholder for the a
graylog node.
Copied Dockerfile from https://github.com/Graylog2/graylog-docker

Start actual server in container

- Manually unpacked tarball to local directory. This is a workaround to
  enable focussing on container orchestration in JUnit for now. Will be
  fixed later
- Copied graylog.conf and log4j2.xml from
  https://github.com/Graylog2/graylog-docker
Add MongoDB
Add ElasticSearch
Fix ElasticsearchInstance so that existing IT still work

Start containers in parallel to reduce startup time

Startup time is now limited by the time it takes the server container to start. That can be optimized later.

Moved container instances into GraylogBackend

This leads to a clean separation between managing containers (GraylogBackend)
and junit integration (GraylogBackendExtension).

Use real artifacts instead of relying on manually created ones

- Take server jar from target folder
- Take sigar lib from lib folder

Load default plugins

The definition of plugin jars in api-it-tests.properties is a bit verbose,
but I decided to leave it like this, because I think it's easier to understand
than dynamic generation of jar file locations in code.
We might still decide to make it more dynamic when enabling additional plugins.
Fix forbiddenapis errors

Set permissions for docker-entrypoint.sh explicitly

Local filesystem permissions don't seem to be retained reliably
Fix dumb mistake in NodeInstance#getApiAddress

Use URI instead of filename

...because forbiddenapis says so.
Mvn package server when executing tests from Intellij

Move new integration tests to existing module

- Moved the test class
- Deactivated all old tests
- Changed how docker-entrypoint.sh resource is converted to file
  Before it went via URI, which doesn't work when executing tests
  from a different module. Write resource to temp file instead,
Add explanatory comments for permissions workarounds
Mount jars into container instead of building into image

Move full backend test to separate module

- Created new module full-backend-tests
- Run all tests in module with failsafe, not surefire,
  to ensure that they only run on `mvn verify`.
  This allows running `mvn package` without running
  these slow tests.

Run only mvn package on travis

Travis doesn't package plugins, so extra steps would  be needed to
run full backend tests.
It should be sufficient to run these tests only in the jenkins build

Disable failsafe integration tests on travis explicitly

`-Dmaven.test.skip=true` was not enough in the second `after_success` step.

Add CLASS and METHOD lifecycle for backend

- Added serverLifecycle property to ApiIntegrationTest annotation
- default to METHOD where server is restarted after each test

Avoid recreating containers for GraylogBackend per test class

Converted GraylogBackend to singleton. This ensures that images
and containers can reused globally.
Add license headers
Use project graylog.conf instead of copy
Use project log4j2.xml instead of copy

Package jars when not running in Maven

...instead of when running in Intellij explicitly

Extract tmp file creation from NodeInstance

- Added separate class ResourceUtil to extract this
  detail from NodeInstance

Allow setting env var to skip packaging

- Use existing jars, if env var GRAYLOG_IT_SKIP_PACKAGING
  is set to "true" (ignoring case)
Upgrade rest-assured to 4.2.0

Allow remote debugging of graylog server

This allows to attach a remote debugger to the server container.
The biggest caveat is that the dynamic port to which the debugger can be
attached is only known after starting the container. Hence one would
have to set a breakpoint after the container start to pause execution,
identify the debug port and start the remote debugger with it.

- Added debug toggle via env var GRAYLOG_IT_DEBUG_SERVER
- Added optional debug build arg to container
- Added logging of debug port, if debugging is enabled
- Extracted building the container to NodeContainerFactory
Add license headers

Disable purging data for Lifecycle.CLASS

Doesn't work, because you can't wipe the mongodb from underneath a running server.
Tests failed, because all permissions were gone. But there would probably have been
even more issues like that.
So when Lifecycle.CLASS is chosen, all data remains in the DBs across tests.
Enable Elasticsearch fixtures

Refactored BackendStartupIT#importsElasticsearchFixtures

... tomake it easier to understand
Cleanup
Added param object NodeContainerConfig

Added README explaining local config options

Placed it in the `testing.completebackend` package in lack of a better
idea where to put it. Can be moved somewhere else after the contents
have been reviewed.

Reduce docker-entrypoint.sh to necessary parts

- Deleted unnecessary code from docker-entrypoint.sh
  (was originally copied from https://github.com/Graylog2/graylog-docker)
- Created contentpacks dir also in Dockerfile
  Dir creation was actually redundant in Dockerfile and docker-entrypoint.sh.
  The contentpacks dur was the only one missing in Dockerfile.
Skip forbiddenapis check in MavenPackager

Add braces around one-line conditional blocks

...to comply with coding standards.

Start mongodb and node in sequence

...because starting them in parallel is not safe, as @bernd
pointed out in a review.

Move configuration of RequestSpecification to GraylogBackendExtension

- Make RestAssured RequestSpecification injectable to allow reuse
- Configure baseUri, port, and basePath to avoid having to concat
  the api path in every test

Set additional env vars in NodeContainerFactory

- GRAYLOG_LB_RECOGNITION_PERIOD_SECONDS: save time on server shutdown
- GRAYLOG_VERSIONCHECKS: avoid contacting version check service
- add explanatory comment for ADMIN_PW_SHA2
Use constant for GRAYLOG_HTTP_BIND_ADDRESS
Add JavaDocs to explain the ApiIntegrationTest annotation
Log Maven command when packaging fails

Improve temp file creation

- More descriptive filename
- Use `File.createTempFile` explicitly
- Delete on exit

Reset skip flag for old integration tests to "true"

Setting it to "false" slipped in when investigating how difficult it would
be to port them to the new solution.

Use explicit Locale for String.format

...as required by our forbiddenapis check

Use explicit Locale for String.format

...as required by our forbiddenapis check

Add check for Maven executable

During his review @kmerz had the issue that the Maven executable
couldn't be found and the resulting error message was not very
helpful for him.
This should make that error more explicit for the user.

Fix maven command

Accidentally left in "echo $PATH" after debugging. :/

Added alternative check for failing maven command

...to see which one triggers on @kmerz's system.
Will remove one of them afterwards.

Warn about ~ in PATH when mvn executable not found

- Extracted check for executable to own class
- Added explicit warning about ~ in PATH to exception message
- Added a note to the Readme, pointing out the directory for mvn in PATH
  must not contain a ~
